intro: Billolivia vietnamensis, commonly known as the Vietnamese billolivia, is a rare flowering plant native to Vietnam. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest undergrowth. Its leaves are usually ovate with a smooth texture, and the flowers are often pink or white in color. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
